website_summaries.verdict: A more expensive tire that uses higher quality materials in the manufacturing process to achieve more reliable results.
pros: The tread on these tires consists of 3 polyester, 2 steel, and 2 nylon plies while the sidewall has 3 polyester plies
The tires are designed to have a reduced rolling resistance to provide greater fuel economy and tread life
cons: Some tires may ship years after the manufactured date
Be sure to check the date code on each tire

customer_reviews.title: Old tires
customer_reviews.text: Received my 4 tires on March 26th 2019. Tires look fine have yet to run them but the date code on them of 3216 makes these tires 2 1/2 years old before I even mount them. Pretty disappointing they are sending old stock out the door at new tire prices.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis M8008 ST Radial Trailer Tire - 225/75R15 BSW
customer_reviews.text: Best trailer tire in my opinion. Lost a tire in extreme California summertime heat on my heavy Arctic Fox RV trailer, leaving a single Maxxis 10-ply tire to support the entire camper weight (with tanks full) for a few miles until I could pull over to change it. Getting back to Ohio after changing the blown tire, I took a look at the tire that held and cannot believe that I made it back to Ohio without having to change the other tire. Outstanding RV tires.
customer_reviews.author: Steel Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Best tires available for trailers!
customer_reviews.text: These Maxxis M8008 are the best tires available for trailers. I have owned a "toy hauler" since 2012. I have had tire problems before and I have seen friends having serious tire problems. After reading many different RV forums, I decided these were the best available. I just finished a 2 week (2700 mile) trip with my family during summer around California, Arizona, New Mexico and Colorado. The ambient temp got as high as 118 degrees Fahrenheit. No tire issues at all, couldn't be any happier with these.
customer_reviews.author: RicardoT

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy trailers.
customer_reviews.text: They hold up under the heavy weight of my Arctic Fox. We run around 12,000 lbs fully loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Light

customer_reviews.title: Fresh off the assembly line new
customer_reviews.text: Very quick delivery. Best part is the tires were only a couple months old. Very important considering ST tires should be replaced when they 5 years old no matter the external condition.
customer_reviews.author: Not You

customer_reviews.title: Replace OEM Tires on your RV Trailer or other trailer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 5 "China Bombs (CB)" on my 1 year old RV trailer. The spare CB blew our and had never been mounted - - damaged back of trailer. CB tires on the ground - - 3 had difigured treads, and would have blown next time I used trailer. MAXXIS is one of the BEST trailer tires on the market. HIGH QUALITY - DURABLE - - LIVE UP TO REPUTATION OF COMPANY. Recommend immediate replacement of any OEM CB tire on an RV trailer before you have $2000 damage or more from a blown tire, not to mention that accident from blown tires is VERY HIGHLY LIKELY TO OCCUR!!!!
customer_reviews.author: PowerUser0173

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good trailer tire
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tire on my 6x12 steel utility trailer for four years now, purchased Oct 2013 here. Tire performs flawlessly and looks like new. Have treated it several times with some 303 outside, expect it to last a long time. Maxxis is worth the extra money. I keep them inflated about ten pounds under top psi spec, they have more load handling than I need. Even tread wear also, I'm guessing over about 8 thousand miles.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: High quality trailer tire  the "cadillac of trailer tires"
customer_reviews.text: I used this product as replacement travel trailer tires. I feel very confident using these tires. I researched and read a lot about trailer tires before pulling the trigger on these bad boys.... Lots of good reviews and they have been on the market a long time !! I got ride of the low quality OEM tires with wich i had no confidence in and am ready to hit the road this season with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Coe

customer_reviews.title: Tire Age Differs
customer_reviews.text: I placed two separate orders for tires. The two tires from Amazon were manufactured 3 months earlier and the two CLT tires were manufactured 16 months earlier. These tires were highly rated in various forums and I will update the review once I have some miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: PASabre

customer_reviews.title: Best trailer tire I have used
customer_reviews.text: My third set of Maxxis trailer tires and these are awesome. Good flat road contact and not "rounded" like some trailer tires plus these are USA made. Get you some - you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Maxxis trailer tires continue to outperform any other brands I have used. Very trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Selling old tires
customer_reviews.text: Tire has a manufacturer date of 22/17 how is this tire new?? Don't buy old tires from this supplier
customer_reviews.author: B. Paine

customer_reviews.title: OLD Tires!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these tires in June 2020. The date code on these tires is mid 2018 - so they are two years old already. Poor. Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: chp5

customer_reviews.title: Best tire!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best RV tire you can buy. Replaced my 6 year old Maxxis tires that I never had issues with. These will last me another six years. MAKE SURE AND COVER your tires while parked. AND TRAILER TIRES should always be filled to what the max psi calls for. If your trailer tire call for 80 cold psi, that what you should fill it to. Not 60 not 65 not not 70 fill them to the max. That's the way these trailer tires work!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby....

customer_reviews.title: Great tires,  Great Seller
customer_reviews.text: The tires are excellent tires. I've been using the Maxxix trailer tires for 10 + years and am quite satisfied with their performance. I purchased thru Real Deal Tires at a great price. They are very easy to work with and shipped quickly. Give then a try!
customer_reviews.author: Tokie

customer_reviews.title: They are black, they are round and they support my camp trailer.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. They fit, they supported my camping trailer, they went round and round like a tire should and were delivered right to my door. Truth is the company forgot about me and I had to e-mail them but after a miss communication there was a two day shipping rush and there they were in my driveway ready for installation.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year old
customer_reviews.text: These tires were relieved in April of 2018 but product date was 26/17 so they were almost a year old when I got them. I will she how they hold up after some lengthy trips.
customer_reviews.author: peted

customer_reviews.title: Major brand tire that seems to work
customer_reviews.text: 2500 miles so far with no problems which seems better than many brands. After reading a lot of reviews I thought that putting a little trust into a major tire brand might be worth a few extra dollars. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S---the teacher

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Paid for new tire received tire made in 2016 nothing new about a 4 year old tire
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P Felts

customer_reviews.title: recommended trailer tires
customer_reviews.text: I read several travel trailer articles about tires made to sell cheaply and several of the readers had blow-outs with the off brand tires. These tires are manufactured in one of the asian countries, but still are recommended by the experts. The tires have an 8 ply rating and are rated to carry an additional 500 pounds more than the standard "st" type tires.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer tires
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my OEM Pace trailers which were these same tires. If these new ones were built to the same standards as my 2004 tires, I expect these Maxxis tires to provide excellent service and value.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tire
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price local shop wanted for cheaply made junk.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lichterman

customer_reviews.title: Maxim trailer tires
customer_reviews.text: Only had them on for two weeks but reviews make these tires promising. I'm tired of these Chinese tires blowing out almost to the point of stopping our camping trips. Next step will be (Light Truck Tires) which make the best trailer Tyres .
customer_reviews.author: Loren Turner

customer_reviews.title: Do not order from e custom hitch I ordered 4 Maxxis tires got 4 Rainier tires cheap stuff
customer_reviews.text: Maxxis tires 2nd best Goodyear endurance best there's a brand Boar tires looked good but not alot of reviews and no telling on price 14 ply though the star rating is for the seller because of how shady this deal went they say they don't have maxxis tires in stock yet that's whats in the picture and description save your time
customer_reviews.author: Nuggethead

customer_reviews.title: High quality Trailer Tires
customer_reviews.text: These tires are excellent quality and I expect they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ranger

customer_reviews.title: best trailer tires I have found
customer_reviews.text: In the past trailer tires never lasted me more than 4 years and if I pushed that I ended up with blowouts. This is the second set if these I have bought. No blowouts and I used the first set 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: David Rabb

customer_reviews.title: It was recommended by a friend
customer_reviews.text: This tire was purchased as a spare for our travel trailer. It is a exactly as advertised. It was recommended by a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ford

customer_reviews.title: I have only had these for a short time on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these for a short time on my boat trailer. Compared to the goodyear marathon i was using i will continue to buy maxxis.

customer_reviews.title: I chose these because I had a stock set on ...
customer_reviews.text: I chose these because I had a stock set on my trailer for 10 years and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than Chinese tires by a mile no regrets will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: john mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Good tires good price
customer_reviews.text: Well rated Tires NOT made in China at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is perfect! They were mounted AND balanced and so far ...
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is perfect! They were mounted AND balanced and so far several thousand miles and we just started the season!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph R.

customer_reviews.title: These tires make for a smooth ride compared so other cheaper trailer tires and allow for easy handling.
customer_reviews.text: These tires last forever. The last ones I had for 7 years and replaced them due to potential dry rot (I do not want a flat when hauling horses). These tires make for a smooth ride compared so other cheaper trailer tires and allow for easy handling.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Old tires.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my travel trailer and the DOT date code was already 2-1/2 years old!!! Returned immediately. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best trailer tire
customer_reviews.text: By far the best trailer tire. After having had blowouts (5) from other well known brands (Carlisle) I switched to maxxis and wish I did it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best trailer tire on the market
customer_reviews.text: I am hating most trailer tires. They all come from China and blow in the summer and over 60mph... Well, these are at least made in Korea or such. Much better than my old Carlisle's and GoodYear Marathons...
customer_reviews.author: T Bone

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: These are great trailer tires. Heavier than most. Never failed me. Seller was right on. Tires had a very recent date stamp.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rose

customer_reviews.title: This is a real tire. I'm so sick of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a real tire. I'm so sick of the cheap China tires. Do some research on this brand and you will see why I chose it.. You will to.
customer_reviews.author: Bishop Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Priced accordingly
customer_reviews.text: Great price...comes at a cost...brand new tire I purchased is already 15 months old per date stamp
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: Tires were shipped faster than expected and the date of manufacture was as advertised. Service life is yet to be determined as I just had them mounted, balanced, and installed.
customer_reviews.author: Rick O.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trailer tires and the only trailer tires I will ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trailer tires and the only trailer tires I will purchase!!!! I put a lot of miles on these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Tnriverluver

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good as one of four tires on a 24' enclosed car trailer, 10,000 # when fully loaded. Maxxis came highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: C. Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Dated 2016 tires!
customer_reviews.text: The tires arrived on time and were everything I expected. I will know more in February when we travel more.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Noelting

customer_reviews.title: Trailer tire
customer_reviews.text: Maxxis M8008 lasts longer than any other brand that I have ran on my 14ft. tandem axle work trailer
customer_reviews.author: Roger Mace

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: One of the tires was very twisted dealer had hard time getting it to seal
customer_reviews.author: James Parks

customer_reviews.title: Great tires, Used these for several years
customer_reviews.text: Great tires,Used these for several years,Never a problem on my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: .Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a very high quality trailer tire
customer_reviews.text: The tires have done well so far with only 1000 miles on them. The only very small issue I had was that three of the tires were recently manufactured but one was older by about 5 months. It would have been nice to get 4 similar date manufacture tires.
customer_reviews.author: pitstaff10

customer_reviews.title: Good tire so far.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect OEM replacement. Traveled well so far. Using on Jayco 256RKS.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best trailers tires on market
customer_reviews.text: OMGosh These are the best by far. The price is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny L. Myers

customer_reviews.title: I have these on both of my heavy trailers. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have these on both of my heavy trailers. I keep them balanced and they hold up well in the Florida summers.
customer_reviews.author: HPE

customer_reviews.title: Price was good. Delivery was good
customer_reviews.text: Price was good. Delivery was good. Product arrived in good condition. My only complain is that two of the tires are in new condition but are two years old. DOT date code is 2014
customer_reviews.author: Fredy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great tires for Travel Trailer, E Rated way to go.
customer_reviews.text: Great Tires, fast shipping to house. Would never use D rated tires as was originally on my Travel Trailer again, these are E rated. I can air these up to 80 psi. D rated are to 65 psi which is the amount shown on my trailer. I travel from St. Louis to WI a lot. Now I can set psi of tires to coldest air temps and not worry about warm to cold weather and visa versa. These are also speed rated to 98 MPH even though I would never go over 70.
customer_reviews.author: vin0023

customer_reviews.title: Older tires
customer_reviews.text: Tires were manufactured over a year ago. Will see how well they do .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New tires for travel trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Tires were delivered to me a day before they were scheduled. Tires were installed a day or two later. Time to put them to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Ride Well on My Enclosed Trailer
customer_reviews.text: Arrived incredibly quickly. Ride well on my 24-foot enclosed trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far they seem to be an excellent tire for my rv
customer_reviews.author: ERP

customer_reviews.title: I have found the Maxxis 8008 st radial tires to be far superior to most all other brands
customer_reviews.text: I have been pulling trailers for 20 years and have used many different tire manufacturers. I have found the Maxxis 8008 st radial tires to be far superior to most all other brands. In my opinion these tires just cannot be beaten.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: On time delivery...did exactly what they said they would do BW
customer_reviews.author: Bill White

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for trailers.
customer_reviews.text: Good prompt shipping by UPS, excellent tire. After having several blowouts on our 27 Ft 5th wheel trailer, and tired of finding good replacements, i did a lot of research. These are very highly recommended by users, and the recent reviews, favorably, in Trailer Life magazine convinced me to try these. so far, so good. They appear to be well made and high quality. I will be comparing them to previous use in a whole bunch of different trailer tires,
customer_reviews.author: David L. Fenner

customer_reviews.title: Great Trailer tire!
customer_reviews.text: Longest lasting trailer tire for my fleet. I usually replace goodyear tires every 6 months due to failure, while the Maxxis las just over a year of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trailer Tires
customer_reviews.text: Maxxis continues to built very good trailer tires. This is the second set I have bought for my trailers .
customer_reviews.author: Nebraskan

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis is still consistantly great
customer_reviews.text: Tires came quick and showed being manufactured recently. Installed them and promptly did a 400 round trip. Perfect!! Towed straigh, handled great, stayed at pressure, and never heated up. After the reviews for Marathon and Carlisle tires all had blow out stories and my past experience with ATV and Motorcycle tires the extra bucks were well worth the piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The Max is tires have met my expectations so far.
customer_reviews.author: Marty S.

customer_reviews.title: ... every aspect of the process with them are very good. You can tell they aren't your average quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these tires a lot yet but every aspect of the process with them are very good. You can tell they aren't your average quality tire. They are very stout noticeably heavier than a comparable tire. I've purchased many new tires and handled them and the rubber on these tires even feels different. With the reviews, fast easy delivery, price, quality observed I'm very happy with these tires that will outperform your average trailer tires!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffro

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Used these to replace a set of older trailer tires. Chose a heavier load rating. Tires track and just feel better. Replaced a set of the "Blimp" brand tires that were less than desirable. Recommend these highly.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis Load Range E
customer_reviews.text: I replaced Tow Max STR LR-D tires with these prior to a 7000 mile round trip out west. They performed flawlessly. I didn't give 5 stars simply because it is hard to judge a tire after only 6 weeks, but temps over 100 degrees didn't bother them. I ran the old LR-D tires at 65 psi and these at 72 psi as they are LR-E with a max psi of 80.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I'd give 0 stars if I could. I wrote a review for these tires; interesting that it doesn't show up. Purchased 4 trailer tires at the end of March 2016. When the tires arrived, the date of manufacture was 2014; almost 2 years old. At the moment, we're sitting on the side of the road with a blow-out after driving 220 miles! I would be extremely cautious before buying their tires.
customer_reviews.author: JanG

customer_reviews.title: 000 miles so far and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.text: Have probably pulled them 20,000 miles so far and they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Schwartzenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great Tires, but old stock
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good prices. Delivered quickly. Mounted locally with no problems. Cons: tired delivered August 11, 2015 had a manufactored daet code of 4514. In other words they were already 10 months old. Trailer tire rarely wear out, they typically fail due to age or poor maintenance. I hoped for newer tires and was disappointed. When looking for a place to mount them, Comment: I called a major national tire seller to install them. They did not have these tires in stock but could order and get them in only three days. They would have matched Amazon's prices. If they present me with old tires, I could tell them to send them back and get newer ones.
customer_reviews.author: ReagentGrade

customer_reviews.title: No issues after 2500 miles
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a previous set of Maxxis tires that came with our trailer but were starting to show signs off too much sun exposure. Researched all the brands and options and felt the Maxxis tires were still the best bet. Towed 2500 miles soon after install and never had a failure. Now have covers on them to ensure they stay rot free.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P Paquette

customer_reviews.title: The order was right. Now to see how they ...
customer_reviews.text: The order was right.Now to see how they last.China made tires are crape!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and this is the best trailer tire out there. Delivery was fast. I have a dump trailer and needed a high load capacity tire. I had a blowout with one of the original bias-ply tires so replaced both tires with Maxxis radial tires and couldn't be happier. The new radials ride nicer and have a higher load rating. I have over 1,000 miles on the tires with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: m8008
customer_reviews.text: not much to write about it since it is only a trailer tire works as described
customer_reviews.author: doug wybourn

customer_reviews.title: but I have heard a lot of good things about them
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them or mounted them, but I have heard a lot of good things about them.
customer_reviews.author: Nemeseos

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis are the Best Trailer Tire our there!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Feb 2019 with manufacture code of 4118, less than 6 months old. Over a year since we got these and Still going strong, look as good as new and holding up great! My local Maxxis dealer cannot get tires less than a year old, and they take 3 to 4 weeks! Update June, 2020 - just received another new Maxxis 8008 to replace the last of the original "china bombs" and I'm delighted once again. This seller is awesome....the Manufacture date was less than 6 months old, once again! Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: JAsh

product_meta.title: Maxxis M8008 ST Radial Trailer Tire - 225/75R15 BSW
product_meta.description: Size:225/75R15The M8008 is a high-speed radial constructed tire, providing a smooth ride with extended tread life. The advanced tread compound, coupled with a robust polyester construction, gives you a variety of workload options.
feature_bullets: Advanced tread compound designed to decrease rolling resistance for improved fuel economy and tread life
Double steel-belted construction for added strength and vehicle towing stability.Max load:2830 lbs
Excellent shock absorption while providing superior load-handling performance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars160 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
